name: Koko
headline: Making mental health accessible to everyone.
description:
We provide free digital mental health technologies for millions of people struggling online — particularly young people. 

For example, we partner with online communities to help find and treat at-risk individuals directly on their platform using our online interventions.
tags: industry:machine-learning; industry:mental-health-tech; industry:nonprofit; industry:social; industry:nlp; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Rob Morris, Founder
founders.description:
Rob Morris is the co-founder of Koko — a behavioral health platform that has served 2M people, mostly adolescents. Most recently, he was a staff data scientist at Airbnb and an entrepreneur in residence at Hopelab.

Rob earned his AB in psychology from Princeton University and his master's and PhD in media arts and sciences from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

founders.name: Kareem Kouddous, Founder
founders.description: Founderd Suzy, Koko (sold to Airbnb), Airbnb Trust & Safety leadership now back to Koko as a non-profit. A few failed startups before that. Coding since grade school. Dreaming forever.

# **The youth mental health crisis doesn't need more awareness. It needs solutions that work.**
We're a nonprofit who has reached over 4,000,000 people by working with digital platforms to provide free, evidence-based interventions.
### We’ve worked with some of the largest online platforms in the world:
![TikTok logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/jcf7rxl2EVPcL35aPhiN8YKaw69RBghMr1wrVzzmUFrLDj-OdRta8S210IEUYRAC_FmwR75vpiEmyvB01h259ReinfEYFbU3G_8D=s0)
![Twitch logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/pR9UNNSjYHzqF76S_06w7-ka0KyRGX3Q7G7GSybV-jz4srcxO8LOSALB3pCInv2dagpPHryGpvbHmvHz2CXzMIVs0GHJt52Pxuo=s0)
![Tumblr logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Xk8cEYOMWDAo5K7ziU2P9O4KRGb-i4KwbHfnHmS8IMhBMsO5UUxcK6oj-vz6icpiqRFdDLo3Iu7cqT0-Ao_usdcf3cS8F3gMtOk=s0)
![GIPHY logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Hger1NBp2iaDDIoR_em3lL1UpnYtzQmL9nL_0Q_LfHld-k4uLKrx1VSOlQWn3nAD0Sy94q5yxQ5Ad9jimuO-une3eM4cC-SKXTs=s0)
![VSCO logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/m2qM3QPp_r9gVTuKZJaqR6kEpk--NAyHNFxXUsTZ-QOdg8NIXnv_sk6gJliniQyIHb2Rho5W3KShtG6StEmsfIfrl9gegeT3k5a3=w101)
![Pinterest logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/yiUlOuGz0q6kqKvCpRXx5B7iLlI6o6gkLHT47zvd05m-hRph5fH1aTIW0EqULJEe5xz_YI-4zAR6Zm6kKowikBd9tad1EFrKHTUH=w101)
### We’ve worked with some of the largest online platforms in the world:
![TikTok logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/jcf7rxl2EVPcL35aPhiN8YKaw69RBghMr1wrVzzmUFrLDj-OdRta8S210IEUYRAC_FmwR75vpiEmyvB01h259ReinfEYFbU3G_8D=s0)
![Twitch logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/pR9UNNSjYHzqF76S_06w7-ka0KyRGX3Q7G7GSybV-jz4srcxO8LOSALB3pCInv2dagpPHryGpvbHmvHz2CXzMIVs0GHJt52Pxuo=s0)
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Xk8cEYOMWDAo5K7ziU2P9O4KRGb-i4KwbHfnHmS8IMhBMsO5UUxcK6oj-vz6icpiqRFdDLo3Iu7cqT0-Ao_usdcf3cS8F3gMtOk=s0)
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Hger1NBp2iaDDIoR_em3lL1UpnYtzQmL9nL_0Q_LfHld-k4uLKrx1VSOlQWn3nAD0Sy94q5yxQ5Ad9jimuO-une3eM4cC-SKXTs=s0)
![VSCO logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/m2qM3QPp_r9gVTuKZJaqR6kEpk--NAyHNFxXUsTZ-QOdg8NIXnv_sk6gJliniQyIHb2Rho5W3KShtG6StEmsfIfrl9gegeT3k5a3=w16)
![Pinterest logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/yiUlOuGz0q6kqKvCpRXx5B7iLlI6o6gkLHT47zvd05m-hRph5fH1aTIW0EqULJEe5xz_YI-4zAR6Zm6kKowikBd9tad1EFrKHTUH=w16)
# We believe positive change happens when you meet people where they are. 
We reach young people on the platforms they already use with free, evidence-based digital mental health interventions.
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/5tWNKu5s0I2C40n9teWizuANVBI_vWIhyZvh7PqkalNeJTsfPyAspedNVtJGpLhQjfBUqQeeNvFnAn0YAR4kUj0o8bOmgZzd1uc=w114)
### Intercept
Through keyword detection and targeted ad placement, we intercept youth who are signaling they need help. Depression, suicidal thoughts, and eating disorders are just a few of the mental health concerns we detect.
![Koko Featured in Fast Company](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/0xRII2wBJx6U9zzhOH9lMZU6TlbL75t5BUKnPaD3NZtDSM04aAcLon6XKE1plICCM2QeHKF746bGPAwthzx9_1imvQ0TXrxkeQ=w114)
### Redirect
We want to ensure help is always free and one click away. With Koko, we can redirect young people to hundreds of helplines, peer-to-peer support, or various self-help courses. 
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ruSvP2B5evcU5w3a4C6SrW62x_NRJ9QERNO8U2eMgMKw4VAenOkYT4vJ3-d6R38e4mD3VNGZawTpMgUN_O841FQjlvU5eiBZP5I=w114)
### Partner
By partnering with online platforms, we can reach young people where they are and keep them safe. Our partner integrations ensure youth can get help on the sites they already use and platforms can ensure youth use their sites safely. 
"A lot of people express online that they are struggling, and we don’t yet have a good understanding of how best to provide help and support. **Koko is filling this gap and providing scientifically-supported tools to help those who are struggling.** They’re figuring out what works best and then putting it to work to help people." _— Dr. Matthew Nock, Ph.D.__Edgar Pierce Professor of Psychology, Harvard_
![Dr Matthew Nock PhD, Koko Advisor](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/YUjiKRd--Hwr0ukcaHR0JjfP2mv_68JcW9ualDakau8Dvq92_9mwDErylzvvfCMGRdAXfK0if4_66aQI8C5B_5z-5P_rqL5Alxo=w16)
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ZIDQ5aV7tpUt0dUuysErGlx5nBLKVi9FZrgKOdz7adtwEDhQTaBAEssonZPK65UEhDtO2D1k214-TjoEUnn9lHR6X8XW1q9yL74=w16)
![MIT logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/AZh2B3pYcU0a3iFT0cPNWE7mt2bHqyh-55XfmCyiWUiaCitPPElG_6AF_U0dpS9SxARQI9iVLjnh-g1BtqjnpotYJhMxopzUCg=w16)
![Harvard University logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/sWbwe38Q3LjOiQ1hY4sGNIVjSjrxlpxilpUZH5q1aDxQiq1Of5ZEJRFR4Xa5MWy51YjCi-VbumzukV0EaBW-EhbyRoC2YQktynYf=w16)
![Stanford University logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/kmjVPRZiVnQlaCxb2gjPS2TIiRM_psd84RJuAG3wb2PU7Uok3r6LIb98MTqBfeVXUHPYJ-Gi6jqUgcBe8PBr4txeDJDeVRwm90M=w16)
![Airbnb logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/hMwiOGVwq5HVa2bDVR2PzLSHlk9FSQ8Tol7AJHOoMQO-qxZUPiotwpwVrMDM6a1QFJrzv_u61Pxc7zFkzzGk9txs5mZMoBwR0XQ=w16)
##  Our bold yet clear mission is to help end the youth mental health crisis by reaching young people where they are.
To address young people seeking harmful content online, we provide assistance by redirecting at-risk users to free helplines, peer support, and self-help courses—doing so in an ethical and responsible manner. [Read More about our ethical commitments.](https://kokocares.org/</ethical-commitments/>)
![Koko logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/2GYHF9GRrlpLbjQa91hiFwOOQvpp62aoelvOclM9Rqfk1gk_x1ehcvelzdaZtiBwNM--eTfIUUtxeDlJQnRI_e-WTy1ngIiOEg=w16)

generated_description:
Koko is a forward-thinking nonprofit organization based in San Francisco, founded in 2020 and a proud participant of Y Combinator's Winter 2022 batch. With a mission to make mental health accessible for all, Koko specializes in providing free digital mental health resources, particularly targeted at young people who are often at risk.

The company operates on a model that intersects technology and mental health. By partnering with well-known online platforms such as TikTok, Twitch, and Pinterest, Koko reaches millions—over 4 million people, to be precise—directly on the sites they already frequent. This innovative approach allows them to identify at-risk individuals through keyword detection and tailored advertising strategies. The goal? To provide immediate access to evidence-based interventions right when they're needed.

Koko's team, currently comprised of just two employees, is spearheaded by Group Partner Nan. Despite its small size, the company leverages machine learning and natural language processing to enhance its offerings, emphasizing an ethical commitment to safeguarding its users. By redirecting users in need to various resources—ranging from helplines to peer support—Koko ensures that help is just one click away.

In a world where awareness of mental health issues is on the rise, Koko recognizes that what is really needed is actionable solutions. They are not just identifying problems; they’re actively providing scientifically-supported tools for recovery. Dr. Matthew Nock, a distinguished psychological expert from Harvard, praises Koko for filling existing gaps in mental health support and implementing effective solutions.

If you're looking to learn more about Koko or support their mission, you can visit their website at [KokoCares.org](https://kokocares.org). Let’s face it—the youth mental health crisis demands more than conversation; it demands action. Koko is tackling the challenge head-on, and it's worth paying attention to.
